thread.title: Watch identical twin girls meet for the first time after being adopted to different families, and yes, you will cry
thread.title_full: Watch identical twin girls meet for the first time after being adopted to different families, and yes, you will cry

author: Kenya Foy
title: Watch identical twin girls meet for the first time after being adopted to different families, and yes, you will cry
text:
Watch identical twin girls meet for the first time after being adopted to different families, and yes, you will cry Just before Christmas, we told you about the story of Jennifer Doering, a Wisconsin mom who accidentally found her adopted daughter Audrey’s long-lost twin. After reuniting on FaceTime, the newly acquainted siblings have finally met for the first time after being separated at birth and adopted by different families.
Pull out ALL of the tissues, plus spare mascara and lashes, because you are definitely going to ugly cry your face off.
During a tear jerking appearance on Good Morning America , 10-year-old identical twins Audrey Doering and Gracie Rainsberry had their emotional in-person reunion while their families watched the heartwarming moment unfold.
WATCH: Incredible moment as two twins, separated at birth, meet each other for the very first time LIVE on @GMA . pic.twitter.com/wILAuUzTem 
— Good Morning America (@GMA) January 11, 2017 ICYMI, Doering’s unbelievable discovery happened late last year because she was hoping to present Audrey with a surprise Christmas gift in the form of the girl’s “Chinese Finding Ad,” which is a method that Chinese orphanages employ to list children for adoption. To Doering’s surprise, she found an ad that featured a photo of a little girl who looked exactly like her daughter.
Adopted identical twins from China reunite ten years later https://t.co/aIbiUwG1LT pic.twitter.com/OCI9z9xlmo 
— NBC Right Now (@KNDUKNDO) December 17, 2016 After some investigative work, Doering eventually discovered the toddler in the photo was actually Audrey’s twin sister Gracie.
WATCH: The story of two twins, separated at birth and how their families found each other. pic.twitter.com/f7z6mB5Z25 
— Good Morning America (@GMA) January 11, 2017 Audrey and Gracie later found out about one another after their parents connected on Facebook, and we honestly can’t even begin to imagine how excited they must be feeling right now. After finally having the meeting of their dreams, the girls managed to sum up the experience in a few heartfelt words.
“It’s very overwhelming,” Gracie said, while her sister Audrey added, “It felt like there was something missing, so it was like, now it’s complete.” 
Aw, our hearts are about to explode from happiness! Hopefully this will be the first of many sweet sister bonding moments.
